title: Trials in the Square
story_summary: Crowds fill the city squares as neighborhood leaders hold public trials for the Council. Former rulers admit how they used the BCI to control and harm. Some are punished. Others are forgiven. Stenograd's people take power, ending the rule of silent machines.

official.headline: BCI Suspended
official.anchor_line: Neighborhood assemblies suspend all BCI-based enforcement as they receive new administrative directives.
official.contextual_reframing: Stenograd demonstrates adaptive governance, ensuring stability through collective decision-making.

official.headline: Public Tribunals Begin
official.anchor_line: Newly convened tribunals invite Council members to address citizens' concerns in city squares.
official.contextual_reframing: Open civic engagement marks a milestone in participatory oversight and transparency.

official.headline: Council Era Ends
official.anchor_line: Neighborhood assemblies deliver verdicts, closing the BCI era and restructuring city leadership.
official.contextual_reframing: The transition strengthens Stenograd's commitment to order and community-led progress.

underground.headline: System Unplugged
underground.anchor_line: BCI enforcement is gone. Neighborhoods get the order - official screens flicker, but real control disappears.
underground.contextual_reframing: Behind the scenes, panic set in as code failed. Assemblies move faster than the old regime - watch whose orders still get followed.

underground.headline: Confessions In The Square
underground.anchor_line: Crowds gather for truth. Council members finally face the people, forced to admit to surveillance, vanishings, algorithmic punishments.
underground.contextual_reframing: Every testimony cracks the old myths a little more. Stenograd remembers who let the system decide who vanished.

underground.headline: Council Brought Down
underground.anchor_line: Neighborhood verdicts land. The Council era ends with exile, imprisonment, and a few pitiful pleas for mercy.
underground.contextual_reframing: This is what real change looks like - open eyes, open streets. The mask is off. Stenograd belongs to its people again.
